chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction
Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andres Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Not to use or possess any weapons. No Contact with the victims or witnesses listed in the criminal complaint. Must abide by injuction  - Case 13FA1408 Milwaukee County. Maintain employment and/or school combination.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED. for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change. Terminated - regular
  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Pro Se Checklist and Wisconsin State Public Defender Eligibility Evaluation form.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Andres  Perez in court with Attorney Spiros Stavros Nicolet.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Counts #2-4 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Stavros Nicolet makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR     *May be transferred to Milwaukee County*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victims/witnesses listed in criminal complaint 
____Must abide by injunction (Case #13FA1408-Milwaukee County case)
____Not to use or possess any weapons

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($500.00) and remainder to be returned to poster)

** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
